stories.original_headline: New research reveals how everyday cues secretly shape your habits
stories.original_summary: Researchers uncovered how shifting levels of a brain protein called KCC2 can reshape the way cues become linked with rewards, sometimes making habits form more quickly or more powerfully than expected. When this protein drops, dopamine neurons fire more intensely, strengthening new associations in w
stories.fantasy_headline: Alchemists Uncover Hidden Magic Behind Daily Habits
stories.fantasy_story: The Alchemists' Guild has revealed a hidden magical essence within the minds of folk. When this essence shifts, it can quicken or strengthen how new enchantments, or habits, take hold. A drop in the essence makes impulses fire more intensely, solidifying new patterns.

stories.original_headline: The deep ocean is fixing carbon in ways no one expected
stories.original_summary: Researchers have uncovered surprising evidence that the deep ocean’s carbon-fixing engine works very differently than long assumed. While ammonia-oxidizing archaea were thought to dominate carbon fixation in the sunless depths, experiments show that other microbes—especially heterotrophs—are doing f
stories.fantasy_headline: Sunless Depths Hold Unexpected Elemental Magic
stories.fantasy_story: Ocean Wizards have uncovered astonishing proof that the great abyss stabilizes its elemental balance in ways previously unimagined. For long, tiny unseen spirits were thought to control this vital magic, but experiments now show other mysterious, deep-dwelling creatures are doing much more.
